intro: Capparis mariana, commonly known as the Hawaiian coral tree, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Capparaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive coral-like flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are typically consumed when ripe. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. Capparis mariana thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of Hawaii.
